word_mean: 强迫性冲动：从事某一不合情理或显然无用行为的一种持久而不可遏止的冲动
强迫行为，强迫症：反复进行的刻板动作，如洗手、触摸、计算、核对等，而并未意识到有何目的

sentence.Network_en: He felt a sudden compulsion to drop the bucket and run.
sentence.Network_cn: 他突然有一种想扔掉水桶撒腿就跑的冲动。

sentence.Network_en: It's a compulsion to write, more than talent, that makes a writer.
sentence.Network_cn: 成为作家要有天分，但更要有创作的冲动。

sentence.Network_en: You are under no compulsion to pay immediately.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有人强迫你立刻付款。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《Friends》词汇表B ... gaelic n. 盖尔语 compulsion n. 强迫, 强制, [心]强迫性冲动 crisp adj. 脆的, 易碎的.
强迫行为(COMPULSION):你会有一种催迫感令你重复又重复咁去做某一件事同行为。
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... propeller n 推进器 compulsion n 强制 compulsory a 强制性的.
用英语介绍几个名词，谢谢！_百度知道 ... 恐怖症 phobia， 强迫症 compulsion;obsession， 忧郁症 hypochondria，.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin compulsio(n-), from compellere 'to drive, force' (see compel)

entry.tran: 强烈欲望;(难以克制的)冲动
entry.def: A compulsion is a strong desire to do something, which you find difficult to control.

example.ex: He felt a sudden compulsion to drop the bucket and run...
example.tran: 他突然有一种想扔掉水桶撒腿就跑的冲动。

example.ex: It's a compulsion to write, more than talent, that makes a writer.
example.tran: 成为作家要有天分，但更要有创作的冲动。

entry.def: If someone uses compulsion in order to get you to do something, they force you to do it, for example by threatening to punish you if you do not do it.

example.ex: Many universities argued that students learned more when they were in classes out of choice rather than compulsion...
example.tran: 很多大学认为如果学生上课是出于自愿而不是被迫，那么他们学到的东西会更多。

example.ex: There is already an element of compulsion in existing government schemes for the unemployed.
example.tran: 政府现行的失业方案已经有点强制的意味了。

means.word_mean: 1. an urge to do or say something that might be better left undone or unsaid
2. an irrational motive for performing trivial or repetitive actions against your will

sentences.sentence: "though pressed into rugby under compulsion I began to enjoy the game"

auth_sentence.content: The tribute...would not be forthcoming except on compulsion.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tribute...would not be forthcoming except on compulsion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tribute...would not be forthcoming except on compulsion.

auth_sentence.content: Even scientists fall prey to the compulsion.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even scientists fall prey to the compulsion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even scientists fall prey to the compulsion.

auth_sentence.content: Compulsion runs in my family like it runs in Russian novels.
auth_sentence.res_content: Compulsion runs in my family like it runs in Russian novels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Compulsion runs in my family like it runs in Russian novels.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必须做的,强制性的,[课程]必修的
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+puls驱动,推+ory……的→共同推的→强制性的
impulse[v.冲动]+ive……的→adj.易冲动的,感情用事的
repulse[n.&v.驱逐,击退,厌恶]+ive……的→adj.令人厌恶的,驱逐的
com共同+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→共同推→强制
ex出+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→推出去→驱逐
pro向前+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→向前推
re回+puls驱动,推+e→推回去→击退,驱逐
pulse[n.脉搏,脉冲]+ate表动词→v.有规律的振动,[脉]搏动

sentences.en: Slaves work by compulsion, not by choice.
sentences.cn: 奴隶被迫工作,没有选择的余地。

sentences.en: Compulsion will never result in convincing them.
sentences.cn: 强迫永远不会使他们信服。

sentences.en: There is an element of compulsion in the new scheme for the unemployed.
sentences.cn: 新的失业方案里有一种强制因素。
抵抗不了的想吃的冲动

sentences.en: He felt an inner compulsion to write.
sentences.cn: 他感到內心有一种写作的强烈欲望。

sentences.en: He seemed drived by some mad compulsion.
sentences.cn: 他似乎受到某种疯狂的冲动所驱使。
